title: Democratic Alliance (Guinea-Bissau)
text:
The Democratic Alliance (, AD) was a political alliance in <a href="Guinea-Bissau">Guinea-Bissau</a>.
History.
The alliance was established in 1999 and was initially led <a href="Jorge%20Mandinga">Jorge Mandinga</a>. Its members initially included the <a href="Democratic%20Convergence%20Party%20%28Guinea-Bissau%29">Democratic Convergence Party</a> led by Victor Mandinga (Jorge's brother) and the <a href="Democratic%20Front%20%28Guinea-Bissau%29">Democratic Front</a>. It won three seats in the <a href="Guinea-Bissau%20general%20election%2C%201999%E2%80%932000">1999 parliamentary elections</a>.
The Alliance was part of the wider <a href="United%20Platform">United Platform</a> alliance for the <a href="Guinea-Bissau%20legislative%20election%2C%202004">2004 elections</a>, but failed to win a seat. However, it won a single seat in the <a href="Guinea-Bissau%20legislative%20election%2C%202008">2008 parliamentary elections</a>. It put forward <a href="Vicente%20Fernandes">Vicente Fernandes</a> as its candidate for the <a href="Guinea-Bissau%20presidential%20election%2C%202012">2012 presidential elections</a>. Fernandes finished sixth with 1.4% of the vote.
